source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentManager

---

# MPPlayableContentManager

**Class**

A shared content manager for controlling interactions between your media app and system-provided or external media player interfaces.

## Declaration

```swift
class MPPlayableContentManager
```

## Overview



The app provides data to the content manager so that the media player can browse the content provided. A delegate provides the media player the ability to perform actions that manage the app’s playback queue.

You don’t create a new content manager directly, instead you grab the shared content manager using the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentManager/shared()] method. After getting the shared content manager, your next step depends on the features your app supports:

- To provide content navigation and suggested content for CarPlay, immediately set both the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentManager/dataSource] and [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentManager/delegate] properties. After setting these properties, use the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentManager/beginUpdates()] and [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentManager/endUpdates()] methods to load the information from the data source.
- To provide suggested content when the user connects headphones, a Bluetooth stereo, or another output device, set only the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentManager/delegate] property. After you set a delegate, iOS automatically calls methods in the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPPlayableContentDelegate] protocol allowing you to suggest appropriate content.

## Providing playable content

- **dataSource**: The data source provided by the app.
- **MPPlayableContentDataSource**: The data source providing media metadata to external media players so they can build user interfaces displaying your app’s content.

## Responding to playback events

- **delegate**: A delegate that lets the media player manage the app’s playback queue.
- **MPPlayableContentDelegate**: The protocol used to let external media players send playback commands to an app.

## Setting the content manager

- **shared()**: Returns the current content manager instance.

## Updating data

- **beginUpdates()**: Updates several Media Player content items at once.
- **endUpdates()**: Ends a synchronized update.
- **reloadData()**: Reloads the data from the data source.

## Retrieving information on currently playing items

- **context**: The current state of the playable content endpoint.
- **nowPlayingIdentifiers**: The content items currently playing based on their identifiers.

## Deprecated symbols

- **MPMovieAccessLog**: Key metrics about network playback for an associated movie player that’s playing streamed content.
- **MPMovieAccessLogEvent**: A single piece of information for a movie access log.
- **MPMovieErrorLog**: Data describing network resource playback failures for the associated movie player, including timestamps indicating when each failure occurred.
- **MPMovieErrorLogEvent**: A single piece of information for a movie error log.
- **MPMovieLoadState**: Constants describing the network load state of the movie player.
- **MPMovieMediaTypeMask**: The types of content available in the movie file.
- **MPMoviePlayerController**: A type of movie player that manages the playback of a movie from a file or a network stream.
- **MPMoviePlayerViewController**: A simple view controller for displaying full-screen movies.
- **MPTimedMetadata**: A *timed metadata object that* carries time-based information within HTTP streamed media.
- **MPPlayableContentManagerContext**: An object representing the current state of the playable endpoint.
- **iPodMusicPlayer**: Returns the iPod music player, which controls the iPod app’s state.
- **init(image:)**: Initializes a media item artwork instance with a full-size image.
- **imageCropRect**: The bounds, in points, of the content area for the full size image associated with the media item artwork.
- **showsRouteButton**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the route button is visible in the volume view.
- **routeButtonImage(for:)**: Returns the button image associated with the specified control state.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
